ocean_sigma_z.z_factors: sigma: sigma eta: eta depth: depth depth_c: depth_c nsigma: nsigma zlev: zlev
ocean_sigma_z.z_bounds_factors: sigma: sigma_bnds eta: eta depth: depth depth_c: depth_c nsigma: nsigma zlev: zlev_bnds
ocean_sigma_z.formula: for k <= nsigma: z(n,k,j,i) = eta(n,j,i) + sigma(k)*(min(depth_c,depth(j,i))+eta(n,j,i)) ; for k > nsigma: z(n,k,j,i) = zlev(k)

smooth_level.z_factors: a: a b1: b1 b2: b2 ztop: ztop zsurf1: zsurf1 zsurf2: zsurf2
smooth_level.z_bounds_factors: a: a_bnds b1: b1_bnds b2: b2_bnds ztop: ztop zsurf1: zsurf1 zsurf2: zsurf2

ocean_sigma.z_factors: sigma: lev eta: eta depth: depth
ocean_sigma.z_bounds_factors: sigma: lev_bnds eta: eta depth: depth

ocean_s.z_factors: s: lev eta: eta depth: depth a: a_coeff b: b_coeff depth_c: depth_c
ocean_s.z_bounds_factors: s: lev_bnds eta: eta depth: depth a: a b: b depth_c: depth_c
ocean_s.formula:
z(n,k,j,i) = eta(n,j,i)*(1+s(k)) + depth_c*s(k) + (depth(j,i)-depth_c)*C(k) 
 where 
 C(k)=(1-b)*sinh(a*s(k))/sinh(a) +
           b*(tanh(a*(s(k)+0.5))/(2*tanh(0.5*a)) - 0.5)

alternate_hybrid_sigma.z_factors: ap: ap b: b ps: ps
alternate_hybrid_sigma.z_bounds_factors: ap: ap_bnds b: b_bnds ps: ps

dbze.long_name: CloudSat simulator equivalent radar reflectivity factor

hybrid_height.z_factors: a: lev b: b orog: orog
hybrid_height.z_bounds_factors: a: lev_bnds b: b_bnds orog: orog

ocean_double_sigma.z_factors: sigma: sigma depth: depth z1: z1 z2: z2 a: a_coeff href: href k_c: k_c
ocean_double_sigma.z_bounds_factors: sigma: sigma_bnds depth: depth z1: z1 z2: z2 a: a href: href k_c: k_c

standard_sigma.z_factors: ptop: ptop sigma: lev ps: ps
standard_sigma.z_bounds_factors: ptop: ptop sigma: lev_bnds ps: ps

standard_hybrid_sigma.z_factors: p0: p0 a: a b: b ps: ps
standard_hybrid_sigma.z_bounds_factors: p0: p0 a: a_bnds b: b_bnds ps: ps

reffclwc.long_name: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Convective Cloud Liquid Water
reffclwc.comment: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

reffclws.long_name: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water
reffclws.comment: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).
